conversation.text: Hi there. Would you be interested in making some vegetable cabbage soup with me tonight?

recipe.title: How to Make Vegetable Cabbage Soup
descriptions: Place the olive oil in a large stockpot and heat it up for a minute or two over medium-high heat. Add the chopped potatoes and the salt, and stir them to coat with olive oil. Cook the potatoes until they are soft, which should take about 10 minutes. Don't overcook the potatoes, since they'll keep cooking with the rest of the soup ingredients. You can wait and add the salt later if you'd like, but adding it now will allow it to blend more evenly with the natural taste of the potato. Adding it later, however, will make it easier to adjust the final taste of the soup (simply add it when adjusting the seasonings toward the end of the recipe).

Place them in the pot with the potatoes and stir. Keep cooking the mixture until the onions turn translucent, which should only take three to five minutes. Stir frequently to prevent the garlic and onions from burning. If either one burns, it could ruin the taste of the potatoes, even if you remove the burnt garlic or onion from the pan.
Pour the broth into the pot, then add the beans. Stir the mixture with a long-handled spoon. Bring the broth to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce it to low so that the broth is at a simmer.

Stir well after adding them to the soup. Cook the soup for 30 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender. Taste and add more salt and pepper as desires. The soup is ready once everything is tender and the taste is to your liking. Serve the soup with a dollop of sour cream or some grated cheese.

conversation.text: I love cabbage and I haven't had it in a while, so this sounds good. Let's get started.
conversation.chosenReferece: I love cabbage and I haven't had it in a while.

conversation.text: Pour 1 tablespoon of olive oil into a large pot and heat it over medium heat for 1-3 minutes. Add 1/2 pound of chopped potatoes with their skin, add a pinch of salt salt and cover the potatoes with the olive oil. Leave them for about 10 minutes.
evidence: Place the olive oil in a large stockpot and heat it up for a minute or two over medium-high heat. Add the chopped potatoes and the salt, and stir them to coat with olive oil.
Cook the potatoes until they are soft, which should take about 10 minutes. Don't overcook the potatoes, since they'll keep cooking with the rest of the soup ingredients.

conversation.text: Alright, I understand. The potatoes aren't too soft though. Is that fine?
Yes, that's fine. The potatoes will have an opportunity to soften when they are in the soup later on,

Add in your 4 chopped gloves of garlic and 1/2 thinly sliced large yellow onion into the pot with the potatoes. Stir them together and continue cooking until the onions have a transparent look to them. This should take roughly 4-5 minutes. Continue to sir rapidly to ensure that the onions and garlic don't burn.
evidence: Place them in the pot with the potatoes and stir. Keep cooking the mixture until the onions turn translucent, which should only take three to five minutes.

conversation.text: Ok, I see what you mean, and the potatoes and garlic don't have to be at the transparent state. What next, sir?
conversation.chosenReferece: Ok, I see what you mean, and the onions and garlic don't have to be at the transparent state. Do you have anything else I should know?

conversation.text: Add your 5 cups of broth (chicken or vegetable) into the pot and add 1 and 1/2 cups of cooked white beans Turn the stove to a medium high so the broth can reach a boil, then turn it back down to low so it simmers.
evidence: Pour the broth into the pot, then add the beans. Stir the mixture with a long-handled spoon. Bring the broth to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce it to low so that the broth is at a simmer.

conversation.text: Ok, I can do that. what should I be doing next?

Continue to stir the soup and add in any spices and your 1/2 head of cabbage which should be chopped. Continue cooking for roughly thirty minutes, or up until the cabbage reaches a tender state. You can give the soup a taste test and determine if it needs more salt or pepper. If the cabbage seems quite tender and you enjoy the taste, the soup is ready! You can serve it with grated cheese or sour cream.
evidence: Stir well after adding them to the soup. Cook the soup for 30 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender. Taste and add more salt and pepper as desires.
The soup is ready once everything is tender and the taste is to your liking. Serve the soup with a dollop of sour cream or some grated cheese.

conversation.text: This soup is delicious! Thanks for sharing.
conversation.chosenReferece: This soup is delicious! Thanks for sharing.

Cook the potatoes until they are soft, which should take about 10 minutes. Don't overcook the potatoes, since they'll keep cooking with the rest of the soup ingredients. Adding it later, however, will make it easier to adjust the final taste of the soup (simply add it when adjusting the seasonings toward the end of the recipe).
